Reviews.Title: “It's near the airport. That's handy…..”
Reviews.Author: Jamesmflint
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night while in transit through the airport. The hotel is near the airport which is pretty much it's only positive. The hotel is dated, and the rooms too. Big comfy bed, but the rest of the room looked tired and lacked basic amenities. No mini bar, no room service, and not much to speak of with regard to an on site restaurant. TV was HUGE… but rarely worked - took 20 minutes to stop showing me the hotel demo, and then wouldn't turn on next day. Shower and toilet dated as with everything. Transfer from the airport took over 1.5 hours to arrive, even with 2 phone calls. I wouldn't stay again. Although you do get free toothpaste!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Overall.”
Reviews.Author: lilemoevie
Reviews.Content: Hotel was good overall. The bathrooms could use updating but otherwise the rooms have very comfortable beds with large flat screen TVs. Our flight came in a little late and so we missed the complimentary shuttle by 5 minutes and had to take a pricey cab out to the hotel which was sad. The hotel website does advertise that their shuttle is not 24 hours. Booking the cruise shuttle through the hotel was confusing but ended up working out well. I heard that Hyatt Place is changing their breakfast to serve hot breakfast items on a complimentary basis which would be good seeing as though most people are looking for a more expanded breakfast for free these days. But the food was good and fully stocked and the hotel was very clean over all! We sat out by the pool which was nice and peaceful and the area was also very clean. Overall we had a good stay and would stay there again if the price was right, there are a lot of hotels in the area so it's hard to compete!

Reviews.Title: “Just "OK"”
Reviews.Author: Fletchy33
Reviews.Content: The lobby area was very well maintained and nice, although very small to accommodate our large group of 32 staying for one night pre cruise. The bar was not accommodating at all with a very limited selection and warm beer. Acutally missed out on a lot of money with us because of this as we wound up going to a local store and purchased 4 cases of beer and drank it in the pool area. Something you may want to prepare for the next time you have a large booking. The rooms were of nice size with compfy beds and the extra large TV was a really nice perk, although the bathroom leaves much to be desired. It is extremely small and outdated. The continental breakfast was lacking and in my opinion the area is too small to accommodate all of the guests needing to be served. Again, our stay was just "OK" at best. Not sure I would want to stay more than one night, but was fine for our needs pre cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Sheila is the best!!!”
Reviews.Author: JORGE5854
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during a conference a few days ago. We always stay in different hotels but this time this was amazing. The front desk staff was great and even gave us an upgrade. Sheila took care of us all the time and made sure our group was taken care of. We will go back to the hotel in the future. We trust the Hyatt brand and never let us down. I have stayed in other hotel in the area but never felt as good as this time. (if my boos was happy, I am happier...)

Reviews.Title: “I won't go back!”
Reviews.Author: A C
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night. Room and hallway had a very bad smell. Lock on door was half broken and I felt that if someone kick the door in it would open easily. The window locks were also non functioning. TV was broken and changed it's own channels. It was the worst stay ever. Hotel host was also rude too. I will not stay here ever again! I was even overcharged. Don't waste your money here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice motel- good location”
Reviews.Author: agrathwol
Reviews.Content: Motel is a cut above average in terms of appearance and cleanliness. Efficient shuttle service from Miami airport and is fairly close to that facility. We used it as a stopover, leaving on a cruise the next day after our arrival. We would stay there again. We didn't have a car, so nearby restaurants were adequate for a one-night stay.

Reviews.Title: “VERY BAD”
Reviews.Author: joeana s
Reviews.Content: I thought that coming to a Hyatt hotel I would come to a beautiful nice clean hotel, but I got shocked seeing a very old dilapidated bathroom

Reviews.Title: “OK as an airport stopover”
Reviews.Author: sraj
Reviews.Content: We arrived into MIA late at night and used our Hyatt points to pay for a one night stop over before travelling on to Naples. I'm glad we used points and hadn't paid as I have always associated the Hyatt name with a more upscale hotel. We picked our car up and drove to the hotel. Even with directions it took a little finding. We were checked in and advised where the hotel facilities were. A request for food was met with 'check what we have at the counter'. I knew a 24 hour menu was available so asked husband to sort this and took our luggage on up to the room. He came up with 4 sandwiches and 4 bottled sodas which cost $40. The room was spacious though the bathroom was small. We had 2 doubles and a large sofa which converted to a sofa bed. The TV was large and there was also a fridge and coffee maker. The air conditioning unit was very loud and could be heard throughout the night. The room was adequate but obviously well used and the carpet made our socks very dirty. We went for breakfast, which was complimentary, in the morning and it was absolutely heaving. It was hard to find seating and queues were long. The food was basic but served our purposes. It consisted of tea, coffee or juice, fruit, cereal, toast and pastries. There was a small pool to the side of the hotel but we didn't use it. To sum up - for 1 night as a basic hotel stop over hotel it served our purposes but I wouldn't have liked to use it for any longer.

Reviews.Title: “What I expected”
Reviews.Author: yargnits
Reviews.Content: I prefer to stay at Hyatt Place. This was a business trip and the room is what I expected with familiar styling and everything where I know I'll find it.

Reviews.Title: “Smooth experience, perfect for an overnight stay.”
Reviews.Author: Poppysouthlondon
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here overnight as our flight into Miami was an evening one and we weren't picking up our hire car until the next day. We rang the hotel on arrival at the airport and they sent their free shuttle bus to pick us up. We received bottles of chilled water in the shuttle bus and we were ferried to the hotel with no problems. Driver was very friendly and courteous. Staff at the hotel were all polite and friendly and the room was great. Very clean, comfortable beds, with tea and coffee making facilities, flat screen tv, wi fi etc. Can't comment on the evening eating arrangements as we didnt have an evening meal but we were shown where we could get snacks and drinks from at any time in the cafe area. The breakfast was fantastic , buffet style with cereals, hot oatmeal, pastries, toast, yoghurts, fresh fruit, juices and tea and coffee. All in all a smooth experience and great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Rude customer service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rochis
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, you have a couple of restaurants and a car rental company nearby, which is good. Wifi works very good too. You can have sandwiches or snacks 24/7 at the hotel restaurant. Breakfast is very good: with lots of fruits, cereal, bagels, yogurt, etC VERY NOISY A/C!!! Cons: BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE. The lady that cleaned the lobby wanted all the guest to remain seated until all the floor had dried out!!!! She would give dirty looks to anyone that would walk UNBELIEVABLE! The guy at the bar needed some training....and some sense of humor too....He would make you feel like he was doing you a favor for serving you an already prepared sandwich at 11 pm!!! One more thing: After we left the hotel, we thought we had forgotten something in our room and called back to check if it was there....they told me they would take a look and give me a call back and NEVER DID!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience from check-in to check-out!”
Reviews.Author: RobSan_IND
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 11 nights and of course, it was nothing less than expected! The front desk staff is amazing and genuinely sincere rather it's the morning staff or night staff! The rooms were clean and well kept and housekeeping did a great job of cleaning the rooms daily. The beds were by far as comfortable as some high ends hotels I've stayed at out of the country or in NYC. The halls and some rooms did have a slight odor, but from doing my own research, I learned that most hotels in Florida do because of the humidity and rain. There are several places to eat around the hotel (Taco Bell, Burger King, Boston Market) along with a small strip mall located right next to the hotel that has a Hertz rental car location, a large and very busy hair salon, a massage place and several authentic restaurants (Colombian, Japanese, Cuban.) Without a doubt, I will be returning to this Hyatt whenever I need to stay in the area again!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms and excellent 24-hour service near the airport”
Reviews.Author: Bourgeois_Yuppie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband during an overnight stopover at MIA on our way back from Dominica. The hotel was modern and clean. The rooms were excellent -- our room had two beds and the bathroom in the sleeping area, plus a separate sitting area with a large L-shaped sofa, a desk, and a small wet bar with a coffee maker and mini-fridge, and there was a big flat screen TV in between the two areas so you could watch it from either side. One really nice thing about this hotel is that you can go down to the lobby and order freshly-made food, any time of the day or night, and the prices are reasonable (not cheap, but they don't screw you over either) My husband and I arrived quite late and hungry from our trip, and went down to the lobby where he got some chili and a glass of wine, and I just had wine. The wine was pretty good, especially for being a house brand. I think the wine was about $7 per glass, and they had lots of other wines, beers, and cocktails, plus coffee, salads, soups, sandwiches, personal sized pizzas, cakes, muffins, apples, etc. It was really nice to not have to leave the hotel to get food, being as it was late and we didn't have rental car. The bedding was very comfortable, and the room was clean and everything appeared to be relatively new. There were plenty of towels, and complimentary soaps, shampoo, conditioner, and toothpaste in the room when we checked in. I think this would be a great place to stay, especially for business travelers, as it has everything you would need after a long day of work, and the desk area is optimized for working, with plugs for almost any type of device next to the desk and TV. We also thought the staff was just wonderful, very friendly and welcoming, especially the night shift guy, who served us our dinner and drinks, and was still there when we went down for breakfast in the morning. The free breakfast was standard breakfast fare with a better than average selection of juices and drinks. One thing to note is that the free shuttle only runs from 5am-11pm, and only goes to the airport once an hour, so you may want to spend the extra money on a taxi or rental car. We took a taxi from MIA since it was late and we didn't want to wait, and it was a little over $20 one way, then took the shuttle back to MIA in the morning. Overall, it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cold”
Reviews.Author: Traveler705
Reviews.Content: We checked in and there were stains on the hallway carpet and it was dirty. When we went in the room it was 64 degrees. When we turned the temperture to 72 it smoked up the room so bad you could not see. (The smoke alarm did not go off). The desk switched us to another room. Once again that room was 64 degrees. When we turned the tempeture up to 72 it would not work. Once again they were nice enough to give us another room. Once again this room was 64 degrees. When we turned the tempeture to 72 it smoked and the smoke alarm went off. The desk person called the shuttle driver and they concluded that we could not turn the tempeture above 64 degrees or the smoke dector would go off. They left w/o any suggestions, appologies or explanation. We could not shower as the room was so cold. Although I like to cuddle with the wife she was soo mad she would not talk to me for two days. Although we are from South Dakota and use to cold we did not like paying for a cold room. We cancelled our reservation for the next week. We asked for a comment card and they said they did not have them. We will never stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service”
Reviews.Author: ckinghim2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hyatt in June 2011. We spend one night and parked our vehicle here for a week while out of the country. The front desk clerk was wonderful. The room was clean, comfortable and cool. The only complaint we have is that someone slammed thier car door open and right into ours. BIG dent in our door now. I will stay here again and being a Travel Agent, I will recommend this to my customers.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: redkimmiekat
Reviews.Content: Decent rate for a midscale hotel. Furniture in front lobby is a little worn. Within walking distance to 3-4 restaurants. Spacious clean room. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: OleLangeland
Reviews.Content: nice big room, but the carpet was wet and the toilet was not functioning

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service - worth the extra 10 minutes from the airport”
Reviews.Author: wimpdiver
Reviews.Content: Absolutely brilliant customer service. Very kind and genuine staff (have u ever had a driver try to refuse a tip?). Manager went above and beyond to correct a small problem. Even tho it is further from the airport than the Sheraton I will stay here again. Sheraton airport was dreadful - even as a top member of their program. BRAVO Mr Collazo (GM) and staff of the Hyatt :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Hard to find.”
Reviews.Author: Sugarloafers
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Place is a very comfortable and convenient hotel if you can find it. It's on a nonbusy street and set back so you have to look for the low-rise sign. I still miss it occasionally even after using it a few times a year. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. The bedroom/bath are separate from the seating area which has a large couch, a work desk, wet bar and minifrig. The free breakfast is good with oatmeal, yogurt, fruit, cereal, and breads..sort of a minor step up from continental with an option to buy a better breakfast. There is an hourly shuttle to the airport. There are plenty of good restaurants in the area. It's reasonably priced. My only complaint other that the hard-to-spot location is that it doesn't have an ice machine on each floor. You have to go to the 5th or down to the lobby to get ice.

Reviews.Title: “Consistant”
Reviews.Author: mhgolf
Reviews.Content: It's a Hyatt Place. No matter whether in ATL, MSP or MIA. If you want a clean, affordable, friendly hotel. Stay @ HP. This one is very convenient to MIA airport. Several nearby restaurants. Nothing fancy. I would stay here again, no question.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Value”
Reviews.Author: aprilorissa
Reviews.Content: Used the Hyatt Place Hotel for our overnight before our cruise. They picked us up at the airport which is always a plus. Check in was fast and easy. Our room was great. Looked just like the picture on their web-site. The hotel was close to a fast food place and a family style restaurant which is where we enjoyed a nice meal. The next morning we had breakfast in the lobby, very good, fresh fruit which was great. Check out was no problem but there was a little confusion with the shuttle to the port. You had to sign up the night before, which we did, but they didn't have enough buses come for the time we schedualed so had to wait about an hour for it to come back for us.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and easy”
Reviews.Author: kiteloungerobbie
Reviews.Content: Everything worked well, and easy to deal with. I love the self check in and check out, no line ups and the huge TV in the room over the bed which makes for a comfortable night. Food plaza just outside and across the street, which is also easy. The only downside was the wait for the shuttle, which was more than 40 min.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: LalaLucy57
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during an overnight layover and we had a great time. The rates were reasonable, our room was clean and had lots of space, and the staff was very friendly. The complimentary shuttle service to the airport was great!

Reviews.Title: “Not so pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: jmhpig
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Hyatt Place Miami Airport-West Doral was not the best. While checking in AND out, the staff did not seem to have it together at all! I've never stayed at a hotel where everything seemed so disorganized. They did not have the correct amount of days I was staying, nor the correct amount of rooms I had reserved. While checking out, the same thing happened...it was as though they didn't have a clue as to what was going on. Also, the room keys stopped working on us all SEVERAL times...and we did not have the keys by our cell phones, as we were told that this was the reason as to why the room keys were not working! I got locked out of my room when I was trying to get ready to go to a wedding I was in...talk about bad timing! Thanks for making me late, Hyatt!!!! Ordered soup for dinner, it came in a cup that wasn't even 1/4 of the way filled! What a waste of money! I should have just walked to the Burger King! We were told to not use the touch-screen to order food because it prints out and nobody pays attention to the ticket and the food never gets made. Anyhow, I had a terrible experience here!

Reviews.Title: “BUGS”
Reviews.Author: Lovelivonia
Reviews.Content: Woke up with bugs crawling all over the bathroom counter top where our tooth brushes were, when I said something they were like no big deal.. Then we were givin a shuttle service from the hotel to the cruise port and the cruise port back to the hotel with our reservations and the shuttle service that the Hyatt hired lost one of my suite cases and the Hyatt will not take responsibility even thou I did not hire the shuttle service I paid the Hyatt to get me from one place to the next and they did not use their own shuttle service they used a outside company. The outside company is dragging but as well to getting me something for the lost items ..

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: pbearcarroll
Reviews.Content: As soon as we stepped into the lobby, the staff's effort to make your stay pleasant was evident. We were greeted with smiles. They were knowledgable about the area. They offered a shuttle to the port for a reasonable fee. We didn't use it, only because we had a rental. The room was very nice & clean. We had my daughter's friend with us, so we really appreciated how the sitting area was semi separate from the sleeping area. My gentleman/husband :0) slept on the large sofa, so that the girls would have privacy. He had no complaints. There was a nice little kitchenette, but you have to go to the lobby to use the microwave. No problem. The nice sized flat screen & work space was nice also. We only had 1 issue, which was in the bathroom. There was a leak from the light fixture. They moved us to another room immediately, & assured us it would be taken care of. We trust that it will.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent park and cruise value”
Reviews.Author: leesvillelake
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night prior to our cruise from Miami. We chose this hotel because of the Hyatt brand and also for the extended period of free parking included with the room. Most hotels give only one week. Everything is clean and well maintained, and we had no problems getting the rate indicated on their web site. The room was fabulous: comfy bed, huge flat-screen TV, desk area, and a corner sofa to sprawl on. Breakfast was just OK -- not many choices and few places to sit. The trip to the port is complimentary, but you must have a voucher issued by the front desk because the van is run by an independent contractor, Doral Transportation. After at least two conversations with the front-desk agent about reserving the van, no voucher was mentioned, so I had to go back into the hotel to secure one after boarding the van. One was issued immediately, but why wasn't I given one when I made the transfer reservation? The trip back to the hotel is $8 per person, and it must be reserved on the trip over. We paid in advance and received a voucher with a number to call when we got off the ship. The van arrived promptly. One other small detail: after I had already washed my hair, I noticed that there was no hair dryer in the room. A call to the front desk assured me that one would be brought to the room, but none arrived. I finally went downstairs to retrieve one myself. The staff seem willing to help, but they have a bit of a problem following through. In any case, we liked the hotel and will certainly use it again when we cruise from Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Terribly managed hotel, in all aspects. Hotel manager should be replaced.”
Reviews.Author: j-travel-27
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this Hyatt Place on two occasions, and it is badly managed which makes staying there an irritating experience. On both occasions, when checking out, the front desk computer did not reflect the rate I had reserved on the Hyatt.com website. They tried -- twice -- to charge me a higher rate. When I protested, I was treated like I was cheating them from something. I'm still waiting to receive a correct receipt, despite repeated promises that it will be on its way. The front desk staff is rude, and service is indifferent. Other management problems -- the shower head was broken. When I asked that it be fixed, I was ignored until 12 hours later when I complained (loudly) again. There are many hotels in the Miami airport area. Stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest Hyatt Place but still a nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Prepwade
Reviews.Content: This Hyatt Place is laid out like all of the others and is fairly well kept and provides a nice room with Plenty of space. Free wi-fi and continental breakfast are great bonuses. This specific one may have been one of the originals. It is showing signs of age and has not been maintained very well. The staff was hit and miss. A few were Very nice and others not so much. The property is also hard to get into. It is hidden in a complex of office buildings and none of the parking lots go through. You have to enter from 82nd street, FYI. Again, overall, not a bad place but there are a lot of good places to stay in this area so I would recommend checking those out before going back to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed o/n before our cruise”
Reviews.Author: AvgMom2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed overnight here before our cruise on NCL Pearl in November. They offered free airport pickup. The hotel was located behind a busy highway, so we really couldn't walk around, but near it had Boston Market (where we picked up our dinner) and Burger King. There was a gas station one block away where we picked up couple of bottled water and sodas for our cruise. The room itself was very large and clean. My husband got excited when he saw the flat TV! The livingroom was very large. The bed was very comfy. The bathroom was bit small, but it was OK. The hotel offered free continental breakfast, which was your basic coffee/tea, toast/bagels, yogurts, and diced fruits. It also has a shuttle van going to the Miami port for a nominal fee of $12pp. (If you want this service, make sure you let them know when you check in. The limited seating on the van gets filled up very quickly.) All in all, a stress free stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but what's that funky smell?”
Reviews.Author: Dive4Blood
Reviews.Content: for a one night stay or a couple nights, this is fine. room is nicely appointed and large. hotel has minimal options for sundries and snacks but the snacks are good. Nice staff. I'd rate this really high but there rooms have a funky smell, like chemical cleaner trying to hide something awful. It's coming right out of the air conditioner too. As with most Hyatt Places, its a step above most mid priced hotel rooms. Huge sitting area with couch and a monster flat screen Just.... what *is that smell??? There are soooooooooo many hotels in the area, I'd go with one that smelled cleaner

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff but it reeks like an old wet basement in there!”
Reviews.Author: sweetsie
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hyatt Place Miami Airport-West/Doral because it was very conveniently located across the street from the office I was visiting on business. Unfortunately, it stinks in that place like a damp, moldy basement. I think it was coming from the air conditioners because the hallways smelled the same way and the closer I got to the the wall air units the worse the smell. But you can't smell it in the lobby. I tried two rooms on different floors but it was all the same. My colleague in a different room had the same experience. At first glance, it's pretty decent for the price: some nice amenities, a very pleasant and accommodating staff. But the odor was so over powering I had to sleep with the window open. It was like 90 degrees out and there was no screen on the window, but I didn't care, I needed the sweet relief from that stench. The next morning all my clothes and even the paperwork in my bag were damp. Lucking, I was only in town for one night.

Reviews.Title: “The absolute best hotel that we have ever been to on vacation.”
Reviews.Author: RobinJeff
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the most luxuriously appointed rooms and 2-story villas with breath-taking views of the golf course. They also have a huge and enticing swimming pool. But that's not even the best part of this hotel. The entire staff (and I'm including the people who patrol with the golf carts) go out of their way to ensure their guests have an absolutely positive experience. Monet Gigi, a Guest Service Agent, Francine, the Waitress and Meryl (front desk) were most helpful to us all and definitely made our stay that much more enjoyable. I had never encountered such pleasant and polite staff as I had at this hotel. The Hyatt Miami at the Blue is a prime example of an extremely well run Hotel with excellent staff and management. If you stay here once, you'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel while in transit”
Reviews.Author: STUandLINDA
Reviews.Content: On our way to Belize, we had to spend the night in Miami and we discovered the Hyatt Place a perfect hotel to stay. We were picked up immediately from the airport. The room was large with a small refrigerator and very clean. The breakfast was delicious with a good assortment of choices. The shuttle was right on time to return us to the airport. We highly recommend this hotel especially since it was reasonable compared to the other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the rate!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bundax
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hyatt Place Miami airport West for 4 days. It is conveniently located. Very close to shopping malls and Walmart. But it is an old remodeled low cost low budget hotel. Breakfast is a drama. What you see on the picture ( 2 kinds of fruit and cheerios), that is what you get in the morning for breakfast. Thee was cold, and if you like bread, you can have it with cream cheese. That's it!!! I expected more for a hyatt place where you pay $122 dollars a night.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel! Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Oceanbreeze22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Place Miami Airport-West/Doral for one night. I wish I could have stayed longer, but I only booked for a one night stay because I was taking a cruise the next day. When I first arrived, I was acknowledged immediately by a very friendly hotel staff member. My check-in was the fastest check-in I have ever had. It took less than 2 minutes, and I was even offered my choice of which floor I would like to stay on. All of the hotel staff associates were very friendly, professional and personable. My suite was VERY NICE and clean. The seating and kitchenette area was very spacious and the bed was very comfortable. I LOVED the 42" flat screen television! The continental breakfast was also nice, if you just want something light to eat first thing in the morning. One reason I chose this hotel is because they provided transportation from the hotel to The Port of Miami, for a nominal fee. Also, this hotel provided free High Speed Internet. If I ever got the opportunity to stay in Miami again, I would definitely stay at the Hyatt Place Miami Airport-West/Doral again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was clean, provided excellent service and value.”
Reviews.Author: delbePa
Reviews.Content: Hyatt Place Miami Airport-West/Doral in Miami, FL. was clean, attentive to consumer's needs and desires. Provided many complimentary services for reasonable fee. We highly recommend this hotel, especially to consumers who need comfortable, affordable accommodations prior to going on a cruise. Hotel was located approximately 15 min drive from the airport. Complementary shuttle service from the airport arrived in timely manner. Two restaurants (Burger King and Italian Restaurant similar to Olive Garden) were within easy walking distance. Complimentary shuttle service provided transport to/from local mall for quick shopping. Hotel offered reasonable shuttle rate ($12/person) to cruise port. In twenty words or less...Manager, Dan, and staff made our 25th anniversary special! Complimentary internet, breakfast and transport to local shopping center. One can save money by using complementary airport shuttle service, shuttle service to shopping area, internet service, larger than usual quality breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Cancelled without notice--confirm your reservation by phone”
Reviews.Author: prayer33
Reviews.Content: We booked a stay here before a cruise to take advantage of the free parking. After a grueling 12-hour drive, we arrived late at night, anxious to check in and rest. We were told, however, that our reservation had been cancelled due to overbooking. The desk clerk said that their reservation system lagged two days behind and though you may get a confirmation online, you may not really have a room. That was true in our case and some others who were on the cruise with us. After all that driving, we were told we had to travel to another hotel that they had booked us into then travel back to the first hotel in the morning to pick up the shuttle. The other hotel, though nice, took us a while to reach in the heavy Miami traffic, especially in the morning. It was not a pleasant experience. Aside from the double booking, the major fault of this hotel was to not even try to notify us in advance of the change of plans. I would recommend if you decide to stay here, you call ahead to make sure you really have a reservation.

Reviews.Title: “The staff at the front desk were amazing”
Reviews.Author: Murragirl
Reviews.Content: We booked through Booking .com and when we arrived on the 19th Nov , after a very long flight from Australia , we found out theta our booking was never sent on from the booking agency , the staff were amzing they found us other accomodation at the same rate gave us a free drink at the bar , refunded our taxi fare of $30 , took us to the Homestead hotel and then collected us the next morning to take us back to the airport , it was fantastic treatment for 2 very tired travellers, I send them a big hug from Aussie and we will deffinately stay there if we can ever get a booking , they are beautiful people esp the manager on the night of the 19th Nov . Thank you you are a special person and by the way I will never ever book with Booking .com again , go straight to the Hyatt site . Marie Caslick , NSW Australia

Reviews.Title: “Great Stop before cruising”
Reviews.Author: Geoff_Monts
Reviews.Content: Stopped here the night before going on a 5 day cruise on the Carnival Destiny (see my review "If this is my Destiny, I want another chance"). Great location, good customer service. Honeslty everyone was kind and we were ackowledge everytime we saw an employee of the hotel. The lobby was pack at check in, thank God fo the self check-in Kiosk. It worked just fine, and got me to a great room. The complimentary breakfast was so busy, we opted for Starbucks and McDonald's. It didi the job before The best part, you are able to leave your vehicle there while you are cruising, with no cost. What a concept Hyatt, keep it up.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for group stay”
Reviews.Author: Sheri14mer
Reviews.Content: The hotel sales manager is very knowledgeable with group reservation and does provide good service to groups. The best thing I have experienced at this hotel is the free transportation service to the surrounding shopping malls and the hotels. The hotel rooms are specious but the bathrooms are small. The free breakfast served is at bare minimum. Beside the comfort, a Hyatt guest aspect to enjoy at least decent breakfast at the hotel and I do recommend the hotel manager to upgrade the breakfast with hot items.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, with a few VERY sketchy moments”
Reviews.Author: GetMeOuttaHere1010
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with my fiance and was in town for a volleyball tournament. The hotel is very nice, decorated modernly with really nice rooms and VERY comfortable beds. It is lacking in the way of amenities - the pool doesn't really seem to be part of the hotel. You have to walk around outside to find it, and it isn't connected to anything. It was also advertised to us as having a restaurant and bar, which is the biggest stretch I've ever heard. There is a physical bar for you to sit at, and they have bottles of beer you can purchase, but it is in no way an establishment for imbibing. The "restaurant" is apparently the cold food case they have that sits rather awkwardly close to the check in desk. They did have a pretty decent breakfast set up, but seating was very limited. This hotel's main problem is that they are ill equipped to handle business when they are at full capacity. The hotel was very busy due to the tournament. Before I left, I called the hotel to find out the procedure for airport transfers. They said to just give them a call when I arrived and they'd send the shuttle for me. When I arrived at MIA, I quite literally called the hotel's number for an hour straight and got a busy signal. I had flown in alone and the rest of my group was on the flight behind me, so I called home and had a friend try calling from her phone. Same problem. I called the nationwide Hyatt line and they were unable to get through to the hotel. My friend eventually emailed the Miami Hyatt and received a response immediately saying the shuttle was coming to get me. It was ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to relax after a cruise”
Reviews.Author: Biahero123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just perfect to relax after a cruise. It is close to the airport, restaurants are within walking distance, close to the Dolphin and Miami shopping malls. The friendly staff and 70's retro style lobby area along with the spacious rooms and big screen are great. It is kind of soothing after the 24-hour entertainment aboard the cruise ship. Did I mention the free shuttle service to the airport, Wallmart and the shopping mall?

Reviews.Title: “great interior design/ambience”
Reviews.Author: racoontraveler
Reviews.Content: Booked 1 night before going on a Bahamas cruise. The room was spacious and nicely laid out, the amenities and overall facility was great and on the medium price range but it is worth it. The receiving staff was good when you get there. Getting there was a hurdle, somehow we got this staff person who does not speak english well and turns out does not really know how to give directions, but this was after 2 phone calls and already got us lost the first time!! Now they have a little cafe by the lobby which is prominently advertised with huge signage, so I try their salad and pasta to bring back to the room. The cook or "chef " was really odd and insisted that the salad (pre-made) in transparent boxes was fresh, "he just made it" and could not be bothered to make a new one. I bring it up for my daughter and she had already started eating it when I decided to try. It was moldy, bitter, sour chicken, really would be a bad case of food poisoning. I made my daughter try to get as much of it out from her system. Now, dealing with the manager was another thing, she INSISTED that everything is fresh without even opening the box, as if a guest would be telling a lie. She even made me go to the kitchen to see where things are, then OPENED the box. Of course, the proof was all there. Now , instead of apologizing she said I'll give you your money back and proceeded to do so, as if that would be the end of that. I don't know if she was related to that cook , or what, it was such a defensive reaction to the problem. I got her business card, but somehow misplaced it after the cruise. The breakfast the next day was good, I must say, but we were extremely carefully checking everything before we ate it. That's too bad, I would have gone back and stay at this place, since we take cruises out of Miami, but NEVER AGAIN. We cannot take a chance w/ food poisoning on an important trip. There are many many other hotels around, since this industry is so competitive in the Miamia area.

Reviews.Title: “Day rate after cruise”
Reviews.Author: CECRN
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after getting off the Carnival Liberty and awaiting a 6 PM flight on Air Tran. We were traveling with four adults, as well as a two and eight year old, and couldn't bear the thought of 7 hours in the airport with kids. I had called a couple of weeks prior and was told that the normal nightly rate would apply, which was OK with me, as no other hotel was willing to even discuss a day rate. Upon arrival at 9 AM, I was initially told that check in was at 3 PM. After telling the desk clerk that I had called the hotel directly and was told that we could use the room/hotel prior to our evening flight, he called housekeeping and had a room cleaned quickly. We were able to partake in the free breakfast that was still going on, and the Starbucks coffee and bagels hit the spot, after the mad rush off the ship. We used the pool with the kids, and this was a very nice end to our trip, being able to relax in the sun, instead of waiting in an airport. Once we tried to return to our room, however, our key cards did not work. The hotel apparently deactivates the cards at noon, as that is when check-out is. It took my husband three trips to the desk to get this rectified. The kids were able to nap before our long trip home with a lay over in Atlanta, so this was well worth it to us. We have stayed in other Hyatt Places, that I believe used to be AmeriSuites, and all have had a funny odor. This hotel did not. I think the price is high at all that I have been to for what you get. We stayed at Hyatt Summerfield Suites pre-cruise, and much prefer that. I would, however, choose this hotel again under the circumstances that we did, but for an overnight stay, I would go with another option for the price we paid here.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: havingfun42
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night after a cruise. The hotel rooms were large and nicely furnished, huge TV, but the biggest problem was the musty smell in the room. The friends we were travelling with had to change rooms because their room smelled so bad. Our room was bearable for 1 night. The smell was coming from the air conditioner. It smelled like it needed to be serviced or replaced. Additionally, the lighting over the vanity and in the shower area was very dim and the bed was horrible. The public areas of the hotel were clean and comfortable and I appreciated the internet computers in the lobby. The breakfast in the morning was standard food in a nice setting. I don't think we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever choose this hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveler1034
Reviews.Content: Everything about it was unpleasant, from the way the rooms smelled to the terrible service, and last but not least having my card charged three times even though I checked out at the desk. If you have any choice, choose somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: jim1011
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. We booked a park sleep and cruise package. The rooms were huge, had a 42 inch flat screen TV and a large couch. Both the rooms and the lobby were tastefully decorated with a modern look.They really helped usout when they agreedto watch our coats for a couple of hours at the end of our cruise. The continental breakfast was great, with Starbucks cofffee!! No complaints here!!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Hotel but Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: fabcomdr2
Reviews.Content: I obtained a good deal for this hotel via Hotwire, but would have been very dissapointed had a paid full price for my room. The room itself was nice; very spacious suite with comfortable bed, large couch, large television, and smal kitchen area. Only negative of room itself is small (but adequate) bathroom. The hotel is located in the middle of nowhere; there is a nice Colombian restaurant (Patacon - low prices, authentic, and very tasty) a short walk away and some fast food joints, but other than that you need a car or cab to get anywhere. It is fine for a quick stay before a cruise (as was our situation) but I would not choose this hotel if you are looking to explore Miami (unless you have a car). The people at the front desk seemed misinformed and not all that friendly. They provided incorrect information about the procedure for obtaining the complimentary airport shuttle (causing us to have to wait an extra half hour) and twice misquoted the price of the shuttle to the Port of Miami. They told me I was being charged a higher price than initially quoted because we were the only ones going on that particular shuttle run, but when the shuttle arrived it was completely full! There were also some upset people who checked in right after us; apparently the hotel was overbooked and they had no rooms for some guests who arrived after having a previously confirmed reservation (they did at least find them another nearby hotel). The free breakfast was rather bland, but adequate. It is nothing I would pay for, but since it was free I can't really complain. No hot items are available, just a few run-of-the-mill standards (bagels, toast, a couple cereals, some semi-ripe fruit, and a couple other items). The tea (Tazo, several varieties) and coffee (three different Starbuck's blends) were a big plus. Do not plan on purchasing snacks or lunch/dinner at the hotel; very expensive and plain looking (i.e. a basic sandwhich for about $10). The hotel does have an excercise room, but it is a joke (no weights at all, just a few cardio machines). The pool was fairly nice. The free internet in the lobby was a nice perk. If you can get a great deal and just need a place to stay for the night, this hotel will do. If you are looking to stay more than one night or can't find grab a cheap price, there are many more hotels in the Miami area that are superior (in location, amenities, and quality) for not much more money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but we didn't feel safe”
Reviews.Author: Kori99
Reviews.Content: We got a cruise package at this hotel it was a park and stay. We left our car at the hotel while we went on our 4 night cruise. They had a shuttle that would pay for two people to get to the port. They told us to be in the lobby by 10:45 AM to get on the shuttle and this shuttle didn't show up till 11:30 AM. We finally got on the shuttle and half way to the port the guy told us how much it was. We told him two people were free and he said the hotel never told him this. We had to call the hotel to finally get it straighted out. It was a lot more stress than we wanted before leaving on our cruise. Then come to find out when we got home from the cruise the hotel said they only payed one way to the port and we would have to find our own way back to our car. Other than that mishap the hotel is very nice. We enjoyed the room and the breakfast was good. We had a problem at the pool. They had some construction going on and the construction guys sat at the pool and watched my 14 year old daughter and 19 year old nieces in the pool. We also had a guy try and sell us watched while we were at the pool. So the pool area isn't secure. I did talk to the Manager about this and at first she was going to try and blow things off, but then after I got more upset she decided to give me the money we paid the the shuttle transfers. She did say that she just started last week and that things are going to get better. I hope she secures the hotel pool!

Reviews.Title: “One wonderful surprise after another”
Reviews.Author: dodgema
Reviews.Content: Booked this as previous reviewer as part of a Park & Fly deal. As my outgoing flight was 1:35 a.m., I used the night at the hotel on way back before driving 3 hours home. What a heavenly restful stop after a demanding trip. The room was clean, stylish and had all the right amenities, incl. the 42-inch TV. It was actually a small suite with wireless wi-fi and a good set-up for a business person. I was delighted to find that there was a "gallery kitchen," which produced the best small pepperoni pizza I'd had in ages. Plus all kinds of teas, coffees, soft drinks, beers and wines. Good selection of salads, sandwiches and other popular foods. The rate was about $100 for the single, incl. taxes and 10 days free parking. A real bargain. Will definitely be using them again if we fly out of Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Great for airport travelers”
Reviews.Author: flapenny
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hyatt Place Miami Airport due to advertised park/sleep/fly package for 1 night prior to flight to Costa Rica. Package price was $152 + taxes for 1 night, parking for my car for up to 14 days, shuttle to and from Miami airport - to me a deal, as park and ride at Miami airport is $8/day and I would not have to get up at 4 am to beat rush hour, post holiday South Florida traffic from West Palm to MIami. My surprise came from the great rooms!! They look EXACTLY like they do on the website!! Room had king size bed for OH and myself, which was very comfy with good quality linens and pillows; room was in earth tones and bed alcove was separated from sitting area by a partial wall. Sitting area had a sectional sofa with ottoman, wide screen HD TV (which could be seen from the bed, also); small area also provided with a table/desk, upholstered desk chair, counter with small refridgerator and sink and a coffee maker. Nice sized closet area next to dressing area and bathroom - equipped with blowdryer, iron and board, and offers laundry service. The swimming pool area is a decent size for the hotel. There is a communal kitchen area with a coffee bar and continental breakfast is served here (included in cost of room). Rooms were pretty well insulated for the location, as we found it very quiet. Several restaurants and a shopping area are within walking distance; the airport is about a 15 minute ride in the shuttle. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful (not always the case in Miami). I think they must have been training staff while we were there, as their food/snack area was not fully stocked and had minimal selection - and there were no drink or snack machines in the hotel. The only fly in the ointment was the airport shuttle service. We had been instructed to call the hotel when we returned to Miami, for a shuttle pick up. We did so (returned on a Sunday evening) and were told the shuttle would be there to pick us up in 15 minutes. When he did show up 30 minutes later, the shuttle was full and we were told we would have to wait for the next pickup. Looking at a drive of 1 1/2 hours at 8 pm on a Sunday, we were not happy. I will commend the staff, however, as when I called the hotel back to report my dissatisfaction, they immediately told me to take a cab and they would pay the fare. Even better, my car was in exactly the same condition I had left it 13 days prior!!

HotelInfo.Name: Hyatt Place Miami Airport-West/Doral
HotelInfo.Address: 3655 Northwest 82nd Avenue, Miami, FL 33122
